fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.items

Class ItemStackBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.items.ItemStackBuilder

  • public class ItemStackBuilder
extends Object
    This class contains helpers to create or edit very customized ItemStacks using the builder pattern.

    Example of use:

         ItemStack item = new ItemStackBuilder(Material.TOTEM)
                  .title(ChatColor.GOLD + "The best totem of all totems")

                  .lore(ChatColor.GRAY + "I'm better than the others.")
                  .loreSeparator()

                  // This one will be automatically wrapped to 28-characters lines so
                  // the rendered tooltip is not too wide.
                  .longLore(ChatColor.GRAY + "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amnet […] elit")

                  .glow()
                  .hideAttributes()

                  // Builds the effective ItemStack
                  .item()

    Another example, if you want to update an existing ItemStack:

         ItemStack item = ...;

     new ItemStackBuilder(item)
          .title("A new title")

          // Resets the existing lore.
          // Without this, lore-related methods
          // adds new lines to the existent ones.
          .resetLore()

          .lore("…")
          .glow()

          // This returns the ItemStack, but also updates it by reference
          // if the builder was constructed with an ItemStack, so we don't
          // really need to retrieve the returned value in such cases.
          .item();

    You want a CraftItemStack for some reasons (like NBT handling)? We got you covered:

         ItemStack craftItemStack = new ItemStackBuilder()

                  // Any method of the builder, of course.
                  .title("A Craft ItemStack")

                  // Returns a CraftItemStack object.
                  // Please note that, as specified in craftItem()'s javadoc,
                  // the returned item is here a clone of the original ItemStack in all
                  // cases. The original ItemStack will be updated if it exists, by reference,
                  // but it will not be transformed into a CraftItemStack magically.
                  .craftItem();

    • Method Detail

      • item

        public org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item()
        Creates (or updates) the ItemStack, with all the previously provided parameters.
        Returns:
        The new ItemStack. It is NOT a copy of the previously provided ItemStack (if any).

      • craftItem

        public org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack craftItem()
        Creates (or updates) the ItemStack, with all the previously provided parameters, and returns it as a CraftItemStack (the Bukkit internal ItemStack representation).

        Unlike ItemStacks, CraftItemStacks are registered into NMS, and therefore will be able to hold NBT data (such as attributes and such).

        Note that the returned ItemStack WILL be a copy of the previously provided one (if any).

        Returns:
        The new CraftItemStack.

        Returns:

      • title

        public ItemStackBuilder title(RawTextPart<?> text)
        Defines the title of the ItemStack. This can only be defined once, otherwise an IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Parameters:

      • title

        public ItemStackBuilder title(org.bukkit.ChatColor color,

        Sets the title of the ItemStack. If a text has already been defined, it will be appended to the already existing one.
        Parameters:
        color - The color for this piece of text.
        texts - The text. If several are provided, they will be all concatenated.

        The current ItemStackBuilder instance, for methods chaining.

      • loreSeparator

        public ItemStackBuilder loreSeparator()
        Adds an empty line in the lore to act as a separator.
        Returns:
        The current ItemStackBuilder instance, for methods chaining.

      • resetLore

        public ItemStackBuilder resetLore()
        Clears the previously added lore lines.

        This is mainly useful for builders used to update an existing ItemStack.

        • If this method is not called, the original lore will be kept as-is, and calls to other lore-related methods will append lore lines to the existing lore.
        • If the method is indeed called, then the original lore will be erased, leaving a lore-less ItemStack if no other lore-related method is called, or only the new lore lines, else.
        Returns:
        The current ItemStackBuilder instance, for methods chaining.

      • glow

        public ItemStackBuilder glow()
        Adds a glow effect (a fake enchantment) to the ItemStack. This can only be called once, otherwise an IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The current ItemStackBuilder instance, for methods chaining.

      • glow

        public ItemStackBuilder glow(boolean glow)
        Adds a glow effect (a fake enchantment) to the ItemStack. This can only be called once, otherwise an IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        glow - If the glow effect has to be applied. If false, nothing will be done.
        Returns:
        The current ItemStackBuilder instance, for methods chaining.

      • withMeta

        public <T> ItemStackBuilder withMeta(Consumer<T> consumer)
        Adds a consumer (or lambda) to be executed with the item's ItemMeta, allowing it to change it as the item is being created.

        If the consumer's type does not match the item's ItemMeta, it is ignored.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the ItemMeta to accept.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer to be executed.
        Returns:
        The current ItemStackBuilder instance, for method chaining.

      • enchant

                                int level)
        Enchants the ItemStack.
        Parameters:
        enchantment - The enchantment
        level - The enchantment level. The enchant is added with the unsafe method, so you can put any number here.
        Returns:
        The current ItemStackBuilder instance, for methods chaining.

      • hideAllAttributes

        public ItemStackBuilder hideAllAttributes()
        Hides all of the attribute lines of the ItemStack.

        This is equivalent to call withFlags(ItemFlag...) with every possible ItemFlag value.

        Returns:
        The current ItemStackBuilder instance, for method chaining.

      • withFlags

        public ItemStackBuilder withFlags(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemFlag... itemFlags)
        Adds the given ItemFlags to the built ItemStack. Flags that have already been added will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        itemFlags - The ItemFlags to add.
        Returns:
        The current ItemStackBuilder instance, for method chaining.

      • nbt

        public ItemStackBuilder nbt(Map<String,Object> compound)
        Sets the NBT tags to be set in the stack. It is set last and will override some properties like display names. WARNINGAs NBT data cannot be added to an ItemStack if it's not a CraftItemStack, NBT data will only be added if you retrieve the item using craftItem().
        Parameters:
        compound - A map containing the NBT tags to apply to the item.
        Returns:
        The current ItemStackBuilder instance, for methods chaining.
        See Also:
        A method to export the data inside a compound as an independent HashMap., Option to replace the whole NBT data

      • replaceNBT

        public ItemStackBuilder replaceNBT()
        Sets the NBT data to replace the whole data in the item stack. If not called, NBT data will be appended to the existing data, overriding conflicting keys only. If this is called, the whole NBT data will be the data set in nbt(Map), clearing any existing data.
        Returns:
        The current ItemStackBuilder instance, for methods chaining.
        See Also:
        The method to set NBT data.
